programme.title: Final Fantasy: The Spirits Within
Final Fantasy
Final Fantasy: The Spirits Within
programme.desc:
Final Fantasy: The Spirits Within: Directed by Hironobu Sakaguchi, Motonori Sakakibara. With Ming-Na Wen, Alec Baldwin, Ving Rhames, Steve Buscemi. A scientist makes a last stand on Earth with the help of a ragtag team of soldiers against an invasion of alien phantoms." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0173840/","name":"Final Fantasy: The Spirits Within","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZWFmYmViNGEtNzM5NC00NDliLThmNTUtYTY1NjhiN2ZjMGM5XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMDM5ODIyNw@@._V1_.jpg","description":"A scientist makes a last stand on Earth with the help of a ragtag team of soldiers against an invasion of alien phantoms.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0173840/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"ndavidg"},"dateCreated":"2004-10-27","inLanguage":"English","name":"Good Film","reviewBody":"I don't know why nearly all the critics bashed this film. I thought it was great! The main reasons people have dogged it is because they don't follow the plot and they don't think the animation looks real enough.

I did not have any problem following the plot. The second word in "Final Fantasy" is a description of the type of movie this is. It deals with the supernatural. The spirits, or "essences" of earth are gathered to fight the alien gaia, as the arms and weapons used against the alien spirits are ineffective and in fact destructive.

This movie introduced me to the concept of the gaia, which I believe is a great metaphor for understanding how all life on earth shares a common spirit. I don't truly believe there is a gaia, and you don't need to either to enjoy this film. But perhaps some found that this conflicted too much with their beliefs.

Now as far as the animation, this is the most realistic portrayal of human characters to date generated by a computer. If you watch some anime films, where there is a lot of action, they will show a frame for a long time with only the mouths moving. People enjoy these animations. Then why is this movie criticized so heavily for not looking real enough? It's rather ironic. You should watch this movie expecting an animation, not a full-feature film with real actors.

One explanation for this reaction is that, like figures in a wax museum, characters that look too real but are not creep us out because they remind us of dead people. But perhaps this is fitting for this movie, because the soul of the earth is sick and life on the planet is reaching its end.

In any case, I enjoyed this movie, and I liked the message. If you like animation and enjoy a good fantasy story, you will like this movie."},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":81118,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.4},"contentRating":"PG-13","genre":["Animation","Action","Adventure"],"datePublished":"2001-10-31","keywords":"based on video game,motion capture,profanity,weapons fire,movie flop","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Final Fantasy: The Spirits Within","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi715587865","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BY2Q4NmRlYmItYTA1Yy00MjI0LTliODktY2UzMWU4OTg4MDc5XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BY2Q4NmRlYmItYTA1Yy00MjI0LTliODktY2UzMWU4OTg4MDc5XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","description":"Theatrical Trailer from Columbia Tristar"},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000285/","name":"Alec Baldwin"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000114/","name":"Steve Buscemi"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001840/","name":"Ming-Na Wen"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0756983/","name":"Hironobu Sakaguchi"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1012102/","name":"Motonori Sakakibara"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0012408/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0035851/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0040831/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0756983/","name":"Hironobu Sakaguchi"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0718031/","name":"Al Reinert"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0899113/","name":"Jeff Vintar"}],"duration":"PT1H46M"}</script><metacontent="

A scientist makes a last stand on Earth with the help of a ragtag team of soldiers against an invasion of alien phantoms." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0173840/","name":"Final Fantasy: The Spirits Within","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZWFmYmViNGEtNzM5NC00NDliLThmNTUtYTY1NjhiN2ZjMGM5XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMDM5ODIyNw@@._V1_.jpg","description":"A scientist makes a last stand on Earth with the help of a ragtag team of soldiers against an invasion of alien phantoms.","review":"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0173840/","author":"@type":"Person","name":"ndavidg","dateCreated":"2004-10-27","inLanguage":"English","name":"Good Film","reviewBody":"I don't know why nearly all the critics bashed this film. I thought it was great! The main reasons people have dogged it is because they don't follow the plot and they don't think the animation looks real enough.

I did not have any problem following the plot. The second word in "Final Fantasy" is a description of the type of movie this is. It deals with the supernatural. The spirits, or "essences" of earth are gathered to fight the alien gaia, as the arms and weapons used against the alien spirits are ineffective and in fact destructive.

This movie introduced me to the concept of the gaia, which I believe is a great metaphor for understanding how all life on earth shares a common spirit. I don't truly believe there is a gaia, and you don't need to either to enjoy this film. But perhaps some found that this conflicted too much with their beliefs.

Now as far as the animation, this is the most realistic portrayal of human characters to date generated by a computer. If you watch some anime films, where there is a lot of action, they will show a frame for a long time with only the mouths moving. People enjoy these animations. Then why is this movie criticized so heavily for not looking real enough? It's rather ironic. You should watch this movie expecting an animation, not a full-feature film with real actors.

One explanation for this reaction is that, like figures in a wax museum, characters that look too real but are not creep us out because they remind us of dead people. But perhaps this is fitting for this movie, because the soul of the earth is sick and life on the planet is reaching its end.

In any case, I enjoyed this movie, and I liked the message. If you like animation and enjoy a good fantasy story, you will like this movie.","aggregateRating":"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":81118,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.4,"contentRating":"PG-13","genre":["Animation","Action","Adventure"],"datePublished":"2001-10-31","keywords":"based on video game,motion capture,profanity,weapons fire,movie flop","trailer":"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Final Fantasy: The Spirits Within","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi715587865","thumbnail":"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BY2Q4NmRlYmItYTA1Yy00MjI0LTliODktY2UzMWU4OTg4MDc5XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BY2Q4NmRlYmItYTA1Yy00MjI0LTliODktY2UzMWU4OTg4MDc5XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","description":"Theatrical Trailer from Columbia Tristar","actor":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000285/","name":"Alec Baldwin","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000114/","name":"Steve Buscemi","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001840/","name":"Ming-Na Wen"],"director":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0756983/","name":"Hironobu Sakaguchi","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1012102/","name":"Motonori Sakakibara"],"creator":["@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0012408/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0035851/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0040831/","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0756983/","name":"Hironobu Sakaguchi","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0718031/","name":"Al Reinert","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0899113/","name":"Jeff Vintar"],"duration":"PT1H46M"</script><metacontent="

A Canadian farmer takes on a giant corporation after their GMOs interfere with his crops." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt8976696/","name":"Percy","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYTA4MDMwYzItMTNkYS00NjhhLTkwODUtNTE1ZDc0ZTUzMzdiXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNDAyMTY3OTM@._V1_.jpg","description":"A Canadian farmer takes on a giant corporation after their GMOs interfere with his crops.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt8976696/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"BrandedToKill"},"dateCreated":"2021-05-02","inLanguage":"English","name":"The GMO companies must be writing the bad reviews","reviewBody":"We continue to see this same theme over and over, corporations, with their legal army, political influence and unlimited resources , continuing to obliterate the working man. Our countries have become oligarchies, our politicians catering to lobbyists and big business. Not only was this an entertaining and well-acted movie, it helps to shed light on the bigger picture. programme.title: The Wizard of Lies
Arcyoszust
The Wizard of Lies
programme.desc:
The Wizard of Lies: Directed by Barry Levinson. With Robert De Niro, Diana Henriques, Nathan Darrow, Alessandro Nivola. The fall of Bernie Madoff, whose Ponzi scheme robbed $65 billion from unsuspecting victims; the largest fraud in U.S. history." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt1933667/","name":"The Wizard of Lies","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNDIxOTMxNzc1Ml5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwMzgyOTUxMjI@._V1_.jpg","description":"The fall of Bernie Madoff, whose Ponzi scheme robbed $65 billion from unsuspecting victims; the largest fraud in U.S. history.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt1933667/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"AlsExGal"},"dateCreated":"2017-05-21","inLanguage":"English","name":"Whatever you do, don't steal from the very rich...","reviewBody":"... is the lesson I took away from the Bernie Madoff story, even before I saw this film. Think about this - Bernie Madoff is serving 150 years, and his earliest release date is 2039. Charles Manson has been getting regular parole hearings since the 1990s. Who is more dangerous? A better question is who is more dangerous to the plutocracy. 

The whole story is basically done in flashback after Madoff is incarcerated and is being interviewed by a reporter. This film takes the approach of assuming that the wife and sons knew nothing until Bernie told them right before he was arrested. If there is anything the Bernie Madoff story would teach you, it is "Don't steal from the very rich". The movie emphasized all of the little people who lost everything to the Ponzi scheme, but there were enough people with enough money left over - as in hundreds of millions - that they could hire attorneys and even claw back money from people who withdrew all of their money before Bernie went bust, even though they knew nothing of the scheme. Compare that to what happened to the banksters who swindled the entire nation - which was absolutely nothing, or Enron, where the Bush administration had to practically be shamed into prosecuting the executives who swindled investors. To date about 70% of the money Bernie Madoff swindled has been recovered, with "small" investors - those that invested less than a million - being made completely whole.

Anyways, back to "The Wizard", which doesn't mention any of this. DeNiro was terrific as a guy who decided to keep his swindling secret to himself - and one smarmy associate played by Hank Azaria. Michelle Pfeiffer as Ruth Madoff almost stole the show from DeNiro as a woman who can't deal with being ostracized and hated for something she had nothing to do with. She wonders aloud how she got to be almost 70 and never learned to do anything for herself. De Niro's Madoff is shown as being able to compartmentalize how he is stealing from investors, many of whom are family and friends, encouraging those at the end to put in huge amounts of money to keep the scheme afloat in the wake of the 2008 crash, which is ultimately what did him in, and somehow sees taking what is left of his ill gotten gains and distributing it to his family and "a few loyal employees" before he turns himself in as "noblesse oblige" not just more theft, which it was.

Hints to Madoff's personality are in the little scenes. He is very stoic about being the world's biggest and most brazen thief caught to date, but he does get animated about a dirty dish and the way lobster is served at a society dinner he is hosting. 

There is one particularly odd scene for Turner Classic Movie fans. At one point, while Bernie is under house arrest, Bernie and his wife decide to commit suicide in "a nice way" using Ambien and a bunch of other pharmaceuticals they have around the house. It doesn't work - they wake up the next morning. But as they lay in bed expecting to die, who pops up on the TV screen they are watching but the recently deceased Robert Osborne and TCM with him introducing Judy Garland singing "Have Yourself a Merry Little Christmas". What an odd touch. I didn't even think anybody at HBO even knew that TCM existed.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":8}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":23817,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.8},"contentRating":"TV-MA","genre":["Biography","Crime","Drama"],"datePublished":"2017-05-20","keywords":"financial fraud,financier,ponzi scheme,fraudster,fraud","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Tonight 8/7c","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi42121497","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTY3MDQxNTU0OF5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwODkxODczMjI@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTY3MDQxNTU0OF5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwODkxODczMjI@._V1_.jpg","description":"The story of Bernie Madoff and his Ponzi scheme."},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000134/","name":"Robert De Niro"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000201/","name":"Michelle Pfeiffer"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0005273/","name":"Alessandro Nivola"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001469/","name":"Barry Levinson"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0008693/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0063961/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0506094/","name":"Sam Levinson"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm2331718/","name":"John Burnham Schwartz"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1345603/","name":"Samuel Baum"}],"duration":"PT2H13M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: American Sniper
Snajper
American Sniper
programme.desc: American Sniper: Directed by Clint Eastwood. With Bradley Cooper, Kyle Gallner, Cole Konis, Ben Reed. Navy S.E.A.L. sniper Chris Kyle's pinpoint accuracy saves countless lives on the battlefield and turns him into a legend. Back home with his family after four tours of duty, however, Chris finds that it is the war he can't leave behind." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt2179136/","name":"American Sniper","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTkxNzI3ODI4Nl5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwMjkwMjY4MjE@._V1_.jpg","description":"Navy S.E.A.L. sniper Chris Kyle's pinpoint accuracy saves countless lives on the battlefield and turns him into a legend. Back home with his family after four tours of duty, however, Chris finds that it is the war he can't leave behi","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt2179136/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"imizrahi2002"},"dateCreated":"2015-01-11","inLanguage":"English","name":"clint hits the target with American sniper...","reviewBody":"it was extremely 'even'. nothing seemed overplayed. well balanced storytelling. as someone else wrote, best war movie i've seen in years...and while we're at it, best clint movie in a few outings, as well... i agree that the ending is a bit sudden. but there was no reason to drag it out, either... i don't feel it lingered on any one dynamic of what would be expected from a film like this...not TOO much violence or proselytizing/flag waving or lingering on casualty horrors... it doesn't, on the other hand, turn away from any of the ugliness, either... i thought bradley cooper did a great job in the role. the changes he gradually instilled into the character were subtle but present. it's as well done a war movie as i'll ever need."},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":456763,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7.3},"contentRating":"R","genre":["Action","Biography","Drama"],"datePublished":"2015-01-21","keywords":"assassin,violence,iraq war,sniper,mercenary","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Theatrical Trailer","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi3484134937","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTg0ODI0NDY5M15BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwMTc3MTU3MzE@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTg0ODI0NDY5M15BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwMTc3MTU3MzE@._V1_.jpg","description":"Navy SEAL sniper Chris Kyle's pinpoint accuracy saves countless lives on the battlefield and turns him into a legend. programme.desc: Die Goldfische: Directed by Alireza Golafshan. With Tom Schilling, Klaas Heufer-Umlauf, Lisa Bitter, Sabrina Dietl. A good natured comedy about tax evasion and disability." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt7689310/","name":"Die Goldfische","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BOTg2YTMyYjMtMTQ3Mi00OTU4LTlmMDEtYzQ2YjVjNWYxZDA1XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMDU5MDEyMA@@._V1_.jpg","description":"A good natured comedy about tax evasion and disability.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt7689310/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"kosmasp"},"dateCreated":"2021-05-12","inLanguage":"English","name":"Pricey fish","reviewBody":"Certain things may be hard for us as viewers to connect to. Not being a banker or someone who is detached from human interaction in general, it is not easy to fully identify with the main character here. And there are flaws or at least weird decisions along the way ... but it is a comedy and it tries to be as funny as it can be overall.\n\nThat out of the way, I had no idea what the movie would be like or any story element, so color me shocked and surprised by the inciting incident at the start of the movie. I did not see that coming/happening. After that "bang" the movie takes a minute to breathe a little bit and that is the moment you see the human in our main character. Overall we get quite a few of cliches though, but still it does its best to stay on the right side of funny and delicate when it touches certain subjects. Funny but predictable - still entertaining if you let it.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":7}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":1630,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.6},"genre":["Comedy"],"datePublished":"2019-03-21","keywords":"disability,wilhelm scream","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Die Goldfische","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi3829447705","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNDZiZjViMDctZWE0Mi00NDdlLThjYzQtN2Q3YWQ0NjEyMmE0XkEyXkFqcGdeQTNwaW5nZXN0._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNDZiZjViMDctZWE0Mi00NDdlLThjYzQtN2Q3YWQ0NjEyMmE0XkEyXkFqcGdeQTNwaW5nZXN0._V1_.jpg","description":"Official Trailer"},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0771713/","name":"Tom Schilling"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1678891/","name":"Klaas Heufer-Umlauf"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm3474804/","name":"Lisa Bitter"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm2285783/","name":"Alireza Golafshan"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0027692/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0239725/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0008261/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm2285783/","name":"Alireza Golafshan"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1487045/","name":"Justyna Müsch"}],"duration":"PT1H51M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Bolt
Piorun
Bolt
programme.desc:
Bolt: Directed by Byron Howard, Chris Williams. With John Travolta, Miley Cyrus, Susie Essman, Mark Walton. The canine star of a fictional sci-fi/action show that believes his powers are real embarks on a cross country trek to save his co-star from a threat he believes is just as real." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0397892/","name":"Bolt","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNDQyNDE5NjQ1N15BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwMDExMTAwMg@@._V1_.jpg","description":"The canine star of a fictional sci-fi/action show that believes his powers are real embarks on a cross country trek to save his co-star from a threat he believes is just as real.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0397892/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"Vartiainen"},"dateCreated":"2016-06-05","inLanguage":"English","name":"Pixa- I mean Disney at its finest","reviewBody":"Lets face it, the early 00s were not kind on Disney. The Renaissance was over, their loyal target audience was in college and thus not interested, Pixar was doing the whole CGI thing way better than them and all in all they seemed to have lost their touch. Until this film. Oh sure, it's still very much like something Pixar would have done and a bit missing on that Disney magic, but it's still a very good film that allowed them to get back on their feet.

And when I say it's something Pixar would have done, I mean that in a good way. Kind of. The plot features a dog, raised to believe he has genuine superpowers, suddenly being separated from his loyal owner Penny and now having to make his way back across USA to reunite with her. All the while having to learn that the world does not in fact play by his rules. Sounds like a Pixar movie, doesn't it. But then again, Pixar is a great film studio so that's not exactly an insult.

And the story and the characters are very good in their own right. Bolt, the eponymous main character, is very gruff and no-nonsense, but also delightfully naïve about the realities of the world, while Mittens, his new cat sidekick/helper/kidnap victim is pretty much the exact opposite. And then there is Rhino, a hamster trapped in a plastic ball and also one of Bolt's biggest fans. Rhino is awesome.

And yeah, it's kind of silly that I keep complaining about the fact that it's so much a Pixar film. It does make it seem a bit artificial in a way, because you know that they're copying much of their good material. But it's a good film, when all is said and done. Do see it, if you have the chance, is what I'm saying.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":7}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":198723,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.8},"contentRating":"PG","genre":["Animation","Adventure","Comedy"],"datePublished":"2008-12-17","keywords":"dog,cat,hamster,reference to tiger beat magazine,time bomb","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Bolt: Theatrical Trailer #1","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi3253338393","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTQ4MDIwODc0M15BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwNTc4MDc3MQ@@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTQ4MDIwODc0M15BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwNTc4MDc3MQ@@._V1_.jpg","description":"This is the first theatrical trailer for Bolt, directed by Byron Howard and Chris Williams."},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000237/","name":"John Travolta"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1415323/","name":"Miley Cyrus"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0261435/","name":"Susie Essman"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0397174/","name":"Byron Howard"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0930261/","name":"Chris Williams"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0074039/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0008970/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1557594/","name":"Dan Fogelman"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0930261/","name":"Chris Williams"}],"duration":"PT1H36M"}</script><metacontent="

IMDb data; ttnr: 0397892, Title: Bolt, --- Description: Bolt: Directed by Byron Howard, Chris Williams. With John Travolta, Miley Cyrus, Susie Essman, Mark Walton. The canine star of a fictional sci-fi/action show that believes his powers are real embarks on a cross country trek to save his co-star from a threat he believes is just as real." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0397892/","name":"Bolt","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNDQyNDE5NjQ1N15BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwMDExMTAwMg@@._V1_.jpg","description":"The canine star of a fictional sci-fi/action show that believes his powers are real embarks on a cross country trek to save his co-star from a threat he believes is just as real.","review":"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0397892/","author":"@type":"Person","name":"Vartiainen","dateCreated":"2016-06-05","inLanguage":"English","name":"Pixa- I mean Disney at its finest","reviewBody":"Lets face it, the early 00s were not kind on Disney. The Renaissance was over, their loyal target audience was in college and thus not interested, Pixar was doing the whole CGI thing way better than them and all in all they seemed to have lost their touch. Until this film. Oh sure, it's still very much like something Pixar would have done and a bit missing on that Disney magic, but it's still a very good film that allowed them to get back on their feet.

And when I say it's something Pixar would have done, I mean that in a good way. Kind of. The plot features a dog, raised to believe he has genuine superpowers, suddenly being separated from his loyal owner Penny and now having to make his way back across USA to reunite with her. All the while having to learn that the world does not in fact play by his rules. Sounds like a Pixar movie, doesn't it. But then again, Pixar is a great film studio so that's not exactly an insult.

And the story and the characters are very good in their own right. Bolt, the eponymous main character, is very gruff and no-nonsense, but also delightfully naïve about the realities of the world, while Mittens, his new cat sidekick/helper/kidnap victim is pretty much the exact opposite. And then there is Rhino, a hamster trapped in a plastic ball and also one of Bolt's biggest fans. Rhino is awesome.

And yeah, it's kind of silly that I keep complaining about the fact that it's so much a Pixar film. It does make it seem a bit artificial in a way, because you know that they're copying much of their good material. But it's a good film, when all is said and done. Do see it, if you have the chance, is what I'm saying.","reviewRating":"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":7,"aggregateRating":"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":198723,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.8,"contentRating":"PG","genre":["Animation","Adventure","Comedy"],"datePublished":"2008-12-17","keywords":"dog,cat,hamster,reference to tiger beat magazine,time bomb","trailer":"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Bolt: Theatrical Trailer #1","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi3253338393","thumbnail":"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTQ4MDIwODc0M15BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwNTc4MDc3MQ@@._V1_.jpg","thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTQ4MDIwODc0M15BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwNTc4MDc3MQ@@._V1_.jpg","description":"This is the first theatrical trailer for Bolt, directed by Byron Howard and Chris Williams.","actor":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000237/","name":"John Travolta","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1415323/","name":"Miley Cyrus","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0261435/","name":"Susie Essman"],"director":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0397174/","name":"Byron Howard","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0930261/","name":"Chris Williams"],"creator":["@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0074039/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0008970/","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1557594/","name":"Dan Fogelman","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0930261/","name":"Chris Williams"],"duration":"PT1H36M"</script><metacontent="

Reluctantly retired from fighting, Rocky takes charge of Mickey's gym and agrees to train a young protégé who's hungry for success." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0100507/","name":"Rocky V","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTM2Mzc4MTYxM15BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwODY5NTk1NA@@._V1_.jpg","description":"Reluctantly retired from fighting, Rocky takes charge of Mickey's gym and agrees to train a young protégé who's hungry for success.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0100507/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"jlivesay2010"},"dateCreated":"2009-03-09","inLanguage":"English","name":"This movie is really underrated","reviewBody":"This movie I know people did not really enjoy. But in a way it is underrated. Because it does really get Mickey back in the show (which Rocky IV stayed away from). I got sad towards the beginning when Rocky goes back to the old neighborhood one night and goes to Mickey's gym and at the end when Rocky is thinking back to what Mickey was telling him in the first two. It also really does have a father son theme in it. I felt sorry for his son. Tommy Morrison did a good job in playing his character. All the Rocky movies to me are the same because they all have there specialties. programme.title: Rocky Balboa
Rocky 2
Rocky II
programme.desc: Rocky Balboa: Directed by Sylvester Stallone. With Sylvester Stallone, Burt Young, Antonio Tarver, Geraldine Hughes. Thirty years after the ring of the first bell, Rocky Balboa comes out of retirement and dons his gloves for his final fight against the reigning heavyweight champ Mason 'The Line' Dixon." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0479143/","name":"Rocky Balboa","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNWIyNmQyNjctYmVmMS00MGI4LWIxMmUtNjA0ODYzOTA0Yjk0L2ltYWdlXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNTAyODkwOQ@@._V1_.jpg","description":"Thirty years after the ring of the first bell, Rocky Balboa comes out of retirement and dons his gloves for his final fight against the reigning heavyweight champ Mason 'The Line' Dixon.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0479143/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"sonicdynamite"},"dateCreated":"2006-12-04","inLanguage":"English","name":"Fantastic finale to the Rocky saga","reviewBody":"I had the opportunity to see a screening of this movie. Having been thoroughly disappointed with Rocky five, I didn't have high hopes for this movie. I am very happy to say this movie brings the Rocky series to the rightful close that the fifth left so empty. This movie isn't so much about the boxing itself, but getting back to the roots of the Rocky story...that determination and courage with the love and help of others makes Rocky a winner no matter what.\n\nThis movie is rated PG, and parents will be happy to see that the graphic nature of boxing has been toned down quite a bit in this movie compared to others in the series. If you're looking for a touching family movie with a powerful message, Rocky Balboa is definitely a movie to see. I think adults and children over the age of 10 will throughly enjoy this movie.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":9}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":209378,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7.1},"contentRating":"PG","genre":["Action","Drama","Sport"],"datePublished":"2007-02-28","keywords":"retired boxer,tough guy,sweat,sequel to best picture winner,computer simulation","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Rocky Balboa","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi3013870873","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMDk4ZDlhZjctZmRmMi00ZjVjLWFlODQtOGY1MjBhNDBkNDYxXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMDk4ZDlhZjctZmRmMi00ZjVjLWFlODQtOGY1MjBhNDBkNDYxXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","description":"Trailer #1, pre st, grnn band, "Christmas", lbx"},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000230/","name":"Sylvester Stallone"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1620989/","name":"Antonio Tarver"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0893257/","name":"Milo Ventimiglia"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000230/","name":"Sylvester Stallone"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0007143/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0050868/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0003580/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000230/","name":"Sylvester Stallone"}],"duration":"PT1H42M"}</script><metacontent="

Having been thoroughly disappointed with Rocky five, I didn't have high hopes for this movie. I am very happy to say this movie brings the Rocky series to the rightful close that the fifth left so empty. This movie isn't so much about the boxing itself, but getting back to the roots of the Rocky story...that determination and courage with the love and help of others makes Rocky a winner no matter what.\n\nThis movie is rated PG, and parents will be happy to see that the graphic nature of boxing has been toned down quite a bit in this movie compared to others in the series. If you're looking for a touching family movie with a powerful message, Rocky Balboa is definitely a movie to see. programme.desc:
Finding Nemo: Directed by Andrew Stanton, Lee Unkrich. With Albert Brooks, Ellen DeGeneres, Alexander Gould, Willem Dafoe. After his son is captured in the Great Barrier Reef and taken to Sydney, a timid clownfish sets out on a journey to bring him home." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0266543/","name":"Finding Nemo","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZTAzNWZlNmUtZDEzYi00ZjA5LWIwYjEtZGM1NWE1MjE4YWRhXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNjU0OTQ0OTY@._V1_.jpg","description":"After his son is captured in the Great Barrier Reef and taken to Sydney, a timid clownfish sets out on a journey to bring him home.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0266543/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"PizzicatoFishCrouch"},"dateCreated":"2006-03-20","inLanguage":"English","name":"Swimming with Sharks is a Whale of a Time","reviewBody":"Marlin, a nervous and neurotic clownfish is heavily overprotective of his son Nemo, who only wants to explore the sea in its entirety. When Nemo gets caught by a scuba diver and taken away, it is up to Marlin to swallow his own fears and find Nemo. The ensuing search and rescue organized by the him is a mass effort by swimming and flying creatures of all sizes and personalities, such as a threesome of vegetarian sharks, a fish with short term memory and an aged turtle, all helping him realise the error of his ways in restricting himself to just his home.

As charming as it is beautiful, Finding Nemo is a joy, both visually and cinematically. The characters are all so appealing and sweet that you want to hug each and every one of them, Nemo and Dory in particular. But the film transcends above just a generic animated film, for there are lessons to be learnt by it too. The film often tells a children's tale from an adult's point of view, with risky situations and emotional soul-searching putting stress on a disjointed family.

The sea is brought to us in such a memorable and unique way that there is brilliance and beauty in every frame. The animation is of all time high for Pixar, and the sound mixing and editing are also to be credited, as they capture the heart of the sea creditably. But perhaps the best thing about the film is the musical score by Thomas Newman. He creates the essence of the sea, as well as the emotions felt by the fish throughout. Note the masterwork that occurs as an upbeat, jovial number quickly escalates into something darker in a matter of minutes. In short, the music is superb.

The voice cast are capable and cannily chosen, from young Alexander Gould as the naïve Nemo, as well as Albert Brooks as the bumbling Marlin. But the star of the show is Ellen DeGeneres as Dory. As the forgetful but caring fish, she is sweet and soulful, and provides much of the comedy of the film. But the humour is also provided by the great script, which delivers a potentially dull story with wit and soul, and shies away from the sentimentality that could so easily arise of a Disney film. And the jokes, what jokes  from satire, spoof and slapstick, they'll be a one-liner for everybody here.

Gorgeous to look at and utterly adorable, Finding Nemo sets the standard for how animated movies should being terms of entertainment value as well as story and themes  ending with the touching, thought-provoking message of how too much protectiveness on the parent's side will repel, but, no matter how independent a child (or fish) believes themselves to be, they'll always need their parents.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":10}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":983049,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":8.1},"contentRating":"G","genre":["Animation","Adventure","Comedy"],"datePublished":"2003-09-03","keywords":"pufferfish,shark,great barrier reef,short term memory loss,protective father","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"3D Re-release Version","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi2687214105","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjMwMDYxNTUyMl5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwNTIwMjQ4Nw@@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjMwMDYxNTUyMl5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwNTIwMjQ4Nw@@._V1_.jpg","description":"After his son is captured in the Great Barrier Reef and taken to Sydney, a timid clownfish sets out on a journey to bring him home. "},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000983/","name":"Albert Brooks"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001122/","name":"Ellen DeGeneres"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1071252/","name":"Alexander Gould"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0004056/","name":"Andrew Stanton"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0881279/","name":"Lee Unkrich"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0017902/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0008970/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0004056/","name":"Andrew Stanton"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0677037/","name":"Bob Peterson"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0721675/","name":"David Reynolds"}],"duration":"PT1H40M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Crazy, Stupid, Love
Kocha, lubi, szanuje
Crazy, Stupid, Love.
programme.desc: Crazy, Stupid, Love.: Directed by Glenn Ficarra, John Requa. With Steve Carell, Ryan Gosling, Julianne Moore, Emma Stone. A middle-aged husband's life changes dramatically when his wife asks him for a divorce. He seeks to rediscover his manhood with the help of a newfound friend, Jacob, learning to pick up girls at bars." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt1570728/","name":"Crazy, Stupid, Love.","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTg2MjkwMTM0NF5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwMzc4NDg2NQ@@._V1_.jpg","description":"A middle-aged husband's life changes dramatically when his wife asks him for a divorce. He seeks to rediscover his manhood with the help of a newfound friend, Jacob, learning to pick up girls at bars.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt1570728/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"larann"},"dateCreated":"2011-08-06","inLanguage":"English","name":"Crazy,Stupid, Love Movie","reviewBody":"I wasn't sure if I wanted to see this movie at the theater,but I am really glad I did. The characters are well played out, not very likable at first, but after you get to know the cast, you really feel for everyone. I thought Julianne Moore & Steve Carrell had great chemistry with their relationship. Super script, nice directing, great casting with Robbie, the son. This movie will surprise you at how good it is. I loved how you saw the characters at work, at home, at the bar & with their friends. This was very well played out & comes together in the end extremely well. Ryan Gosling is very hot even when he is sleazy. Great date night movie!!"},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":491737,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7.4},"contentRating":"PG-13","genre":["Comedy","Drama","Romance"],"datePublished":"2011-07-29","keywords":"divorce,male objectification,marriage,unfaithfulness,adultery","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Crazy, Stupid, Love.","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi3722091801","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjA0MTY2NzgwMl5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwMzYzNDg4NA@@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjA0MTY2NzgwMl5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwMzYzNDg4NA@@._V1_.jpg","description":"Newly single Cal Weaver (Steve Carell) is taken on as wingman and protÃ©gÃ© to handsome, thirtysomething player Jacob Palmer (Ryan Gosling). programme.title: The Handmaid's Tale
The Handmaid's Tale
Opowieść podręcznej
The Handmaid's Tale
programme.desc: The Handmaid's Tale: Created by Bruce Miller. With Elisabeth Moss, Yvonne Strahovski, Joseph Fiennes, Ann Dowd. Set in a dystopian future, a woman is forced to live as a concubine under a fundamentalist theocratic dictatorship." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"TVSeries","url":"/title/tt5834204/","name":"The Handmaid's Tale","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZGZiMTkzZjktNzk0OC00NzEzLWJjOTMtYjdkMWM1NGU1ZDM4XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMTEyMjM2NDc2._V1_.jpg","description":"Set in a dystopian future, a woman is forced to live as a concubine under a fundamentalist theocratic dictatorship.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt5834204/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"gottawalkit"},"dateCreated":"2017-06-15","inLanguage":"English","name":"You think you have seen horror films?","reviewBody":"If I may start 'off-topic' for a moment. I am male, mid sixties, and have watched, like many others, all the great (and not-so-great) horror films. After watching the ten episodes of 'The Handmaid's Tale' I can safely say that THIS is a real horror story. It makes the entire horror genre seem like cotton candy. After each episode I find myself shaking, often with tears in my eyes. I'm not going to talk about the story. I am going to tell you that the acting is beyond reproach. In almost every movie, every TV series, there are at least one or two characters that don't fit or are poorly portrayed. Not so here. I simply cannot find fault with the performances of the entire cast. Stellar! The sets, the direction, the camera work, the intensity all fit together seamlessly. This is a story of a good world...gone very wrong. This is a story about faith, twisted by evil intent, then thrust upon the common people. For me it is truly horrifying. I'm sorry I can't find better words to describe how this show affects me. I will say this: My daughter is currently attending university in the U.S. and I can tell you I fear for her safety every hour of every day. Not because this story is happening now...but because it is so close.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":10}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":200987,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":8.4},"contentRating":"TV-MA","genre":["Drama","Sci-Fi","Thriller"],"datePublished":"2017-04-26","keywords":"rape,dystopia,violence against women,slavery,torture","actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0005253/","name":"Elisabeth Moss"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm2088803/","name":"Yvonne Strahovski"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001212/","name":"Joseph Fiennes"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0071026/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0108881/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0588005/","name":"Bruce Miller"}],"trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Season 4 Trailer","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi2726412313","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZTljMGNkYTMtMzE3MS00ZjM2LThjY2ItM2Q5YTVhYmI0ZmEzXkEyXkFqcGdeQXZ3ZXNsZXk@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZTljMGNkYTMtMzE3MS00ZjM2LThjY2ItM2Q5YTVhYmI0ZmEzXkEyXkFqcGdeQXZ3ZXNsZXk@._V1_.jpg","description":"Freedom is just the beginning. The Emmy-winning series, The Handmaid's Tale, returns for Season 4 on April 28, 2021, only on Hulu.\n\nThe cultural phenomenon picks up where we left off, with June's fight for freedom against Gilead. But the risks she takes bring unexpected and dangerous new challenges, and her desire for justice and revenge threaten to consume her and destroy her most cherished relationships."}}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: The White Lotus
The White Lotus
Biały Lotos
The White Lotus
programme.desc: The White Lotus: Created by Mike White. With Murray Bartlett, Connie Britton, Jennifer Coolidge, Alexandra Daddario. Set in a tropical resort, it follows the exploits of various guests and employees over the span of a week." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"TVSeries","url":"/title/tt13406094/","name":"The White Lotus","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BOWY1YjY1MWUtYWY5Yi00YTM4LTkyM2UtMDQ3NmFiYTkyYjlkXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMDM2NDM2MQ@@._V1_.jpg","description":"Set in a tropical resort, it follows the exploits of various guests and employees over the span of a week.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt13406094/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"idospasjody"},"dateCreated":"2021-08-11","inLanguage":"English","name":"This is the BEST dark comedy in years","reviewBody":"This is a gem. The writing and acting is amazing. I can't wait for every Sunday evening. I wish I wouldn't have started it so I could binge watch the hole thing. There are parts that it takes a few seconds for your brain to process and then bang OMG laugh out loud funny. Rewind watch again funny. The story telling is masterful. Only thing wrong with this show is can't find anything to it's equal wile waiting for the next one to be released.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":10}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":27138,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7.7},"contentRating":"TV-MA","genre":["Comedy","Drama"],"datePublished":"2021-07-11","keywords":"male explicit nudity,resort,full frontal male nudity,social satire,satire","actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0058864/","name":"Murray Bartlett"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0110168/","name":"Connie Britton"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0177639/","name":"Jennifer Coolidge"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0193472/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0925234/","name":"Mike White"}],"trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Official Trailer","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi1544732697","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYTRkZmMyYmMtNDNiYi00MDYyLTgyYTEtNmVhYjcwZTljZWRjXkEyXkFqcGdeQXZ3ZXNsZXk@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYTRkZmMyYmMtNDNiYi00MDYyLTgyYTEtNmVhYjcwZTljZWRjXkEyXkFqcGdeQXZ3ZXNsZXk@._V1_.jpg","description":"Among the employees at The White Lotus are the fastidious resort manager Armond (Murray Bartlett), who, after a sudden trauma, begins a dramatic downward spiral - and the down-to-earth spa manager, Belinda (Natasha Rothwell) who gets taken on an emotional roller coaster ride by a needy guest. The vacationers include the Mossbacher family - Nicole (Connie Britton), a successful type-A exec, who can't help but treat her family like disobedient employees; her husband, Mark (Steve Zahn), dealing with both an embarrassing health crisis and a terminal inferiority complex; their teenaged son, Quinn (Fred Hechinger), a socially awkward gamer, experiencing the wonder of nature for the very first time; their daughter, Olivia (Sydney Sweeney), and her friend, Paula (Brittany O'Grady), sharp-tongued college sophomores who cast a sardonic eye on the lifestyles and belief systems of everyone around them. The handsome, entitled Shane Patton (Jake Lacy) is here with his beautiful bride, Rachel (Alexandra Daddario). Shane and Rachel are in the throes of young love, but as they get to know each other better in this new, intimate environment, clouds of doubt appear - and by the time Shane's intrusive mother, Kitty (Molly Shannon) surprises them with an unwelcome visit, their fairytale honeymoon has begun to unravel. And finally, there is Tanya McQuoid (Jennifer Coolidge), a wealthy, unstable woman, recovering from the death of her mother, traveling alone to the hotel, looking for love and in desperate need of a massage."}}</script><metacontent="

credits.actor: Murray Bartlett, Connie Britton, Jennifer Coolidge, Alexandra Daddario, Fred Hechinger, Jake Lacy, Brittany O'Grady, Natasha Rothwell, Sydney Sweeney

Set in a tropical resort, it follows the exploits of various guests and employees over the span of a week." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"TVSeries","url":"/title/tt13406094/","name":"The White Lotus","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BOWY1YjY1MWUtYWY5Yi00YTM4LTkyM2UtMDQ3NmFiYTkyYjlkXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMDM2NDM2MQ@@._V1_.jpg","description":"Set in a tropical resort, it follows the exploits of various guests and employees over the span of a week.","review":"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt13406094/","author":"@type":"Person","name":"idospasjody","dateCreated":"2021-08-11","inLanguage":"English","name":"This is the BEST dark comedy in years","reviewBody":"This is a gem. The writing and acting is amazing. I can't wait for every Sunday evening. I wish I wouldn't have started it so I could binge watch the hole thing. There are parts that it takes a few seconds for your brain to process and then bang OMG laugh out loud funny. Rewind watch again funny. The story telling is masterful. Only thing wrong with this show is can't find anything to it's equal wile waiting for the next one to be released.","reviewRating":"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":10,"aggregateRating":"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":27138,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7.7,"contentRating":"TV-MA","genre":["Comedy","Drama"],"datePublished":"2021-07-11","keywords":"male explicit nudity,resort,full frontal male nudity,social satire,satire","actor":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0058864/","name":"Murray Bartlett","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0110168/","name":"Connie Britton","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0177639/","name":"Jennifer Coolidge"],"creator":["@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0193472/","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0925234/","name":"Mike White"],"trailer":"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Official Trailer","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi1544732697","thumbnail":"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYTRkZmMyYmMtNDNiYi00MDYyLTgyYTEtNmVhYjcwZTljZWRjXkEyXkFqcGdeQXZ3ZXNsZXk@._V1_.jpg","thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYTRkZmMyYmMtNDNiYi00MDYyLTgyYTEtNmVhYjcwZTljZWRjXkEyXkFqcGdeQXZ3ZXNsZXk@._V1_.jpg","description":"Among the employees at The White Lotus are the fastidious resort manager Armond (Murray Bartlett), who, after a sudden trauma, begins a dramatic downward spiral - and the down-to-earth spa manager, Belinda (Natasha Rothwell) who gets taken on an emotional roller coaster ride by a needy guest. The vacationers include the Mossbacher family - Nicole (Connie Britton), a successful type-A exec, who can't help but treat her family like disobedient employees; her husband, Mark (Steve Zahn), dealing with both an embarrassing health crisis and a terminal inferiority complex; their teenaged son, Quinn (Fred Hechinger), a socially awkward gamer, experiencing the wonder of nature for the very first time; their daughter, Olivia (Sydney Sweeney), and her friend, Paula (Brittany O'Grady), sharp-tongued college sophomores who cast a sardonic eye on the lifestyles and belief systems of everyone around them. The handsome, entitled Shane Patton (Jake Lacy) is here with his beautiful bride, Rachel (Alexandra Daddario). Shane and Rachel are in the throes of young love, but as they get to know each other better in this new, intimate environment, clouds of doubt appear - and by the time Shane's intrusive mother, Kitty (Molly Shannon) surprises them with an unwelcome visit, their fairytale honeymoon has begun to unravel. And finally, there is Tanya McQuoid (Jennifer Coolidge), a wealthy, unstable woman, recovering from the death of her mother, traveling alone to the hotel, looking for love and in desperate need of a massage."</script><metacontent="

Kłamstwo doskonałe
The Good Liar
programme.desc: Die Goldfische: Directed by Alireza Golafshan. With Tom Schilling, Klaas Heufer-Umlauf, Lisa Bitter, Sabrina Dietl. A good natured comedy about tax evasion and disability." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt7689310/","name":"Die Goldfische","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BOTg2YTMyYjMtMTQ3Mi00OTU4LTlmMDEtYzQ2YjVjNWYxZDA1XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMDU5MDEyMA@@._V1_.jpg","description":"A good natured comedy about tax evasion and disability.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt7689310/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"kosmasp"},"dateCreated":"2021-05-12","inLanguage":"English","name":"Pricey fish","reviewBody":"Certain things may be hard for us as viewers to connect to. Not being a banker or someone who is detached from human interaction in general, it is not easy to fully identify with the main character here. And there are flaws or at least weird decisions along the way ... but it is a comedy and it tries to be as funny as it can be overall.\n\nThat out of the way, I had no idea what the movie would be like or any story element, so color me shocked and surprised by the inciting incident at the start of the movie. I did not see that coming/happening. After that "bang" the movie takes a minute to breathe a little bit and that is the moment you see the human in our main character. Overall we get quite a few of cliches though, but still it does its best to stay on the right side of funny and delicate when it touches certain subjects. Funny but predictable - still entertaining if you let it.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":7}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":1630,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.6},"genre":["Comedy"],"datePublished":"2019-03-21","keywords":"disability,wilhelm scream","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Die Goldfische","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi3829447705","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNDZiZjViMDctZWE0Mi00NDdlLThjYzQtN2Q3YWQ0NjEyMmE0XkEyXkFqcGdeQTNwaW5nZXN0._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNDZiZjViMDctZWE0Mi00NDdlLThjYzQtN2Q3YWQ0NjEyMmE0XkEyXkFqcGdeQTNwaW5nZXN0._V1_.jpg","description":"Official Trailer"},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0771713/","name":"Tom Schilling"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1678891/","name":"Klaas Heufer-Umlauf"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm3474804/","name":"Lisa Bitter"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm2285783/","name":"Alireza Golafshan"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0027692/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0239725/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0008261/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm2285783/","name":"Alireza Golafshan"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1487045/","name":"Justyna Müsch"}],"duration":"PT1H51M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: The Handmaid's Tale
The Handmaid's Tale
Opowieść podręcznej
The Handmaid's Tale
programme.desc: The Handmaid's Tale: Created by Bruce Miller. With Elisabeth Moss, Yvonne Strahovski, Joseph Fiennes, Ann Dowd. Set in a dystopian future, a woman is forced to live as a concubine under a fundamentalist theocratic dictatorship." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"TVSeries","url":"/title/tt5834204/","name":"The Handmaid's Tale","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZGZiMTkzZjktNzk0OC00NzEzLWJjOTMtYjdkMWM1NGU1ZDM4XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMTEyMjM2NDc2._V1_.jpg","description":"Set in a dystopian future, a woman is forced to live as a concubine under a fundamentalist theocratic dictatorship.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt5834204/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"gottawalkit"},"dateCreated":"2017-06-15","inLanguage":"English","name":"You think you have seen horror films?","reviewBody":"If I may start 'off-topic' for a moment. I am male, mid sixties, and have watched, like many others, all the great (and not-so-great) horror films. After watching the ten episodes of 'The Handmaid's Tale' I can safely say that THIS is a real horror story. It makes the entire horror genre seem like cotton candy. After each episode I find myself shaking, often with tears in my eyes. I'm not going to talk about the story. I am going to tell you that the acting is beyond reproach. In almost every movie, every TV series, there are at least one or two characters that don't fit or are poorly portrayed. Not so here. I simply cannot find fault with the performances of the entire cast. Stellar! The sets, the direction, the camera work, the intensity all fit together seamlessly. This is a story of a good world...gone very wrong. This is a story about faith, twisted by evil intent, then thrust upon the common people. For me it is truly horrifying. I'm sorry I can't find better words to describe how this show affects me. I will say this: My daughter is currently attending university in the U.S. and I can tell you I fear for her safety every hour of every day. Not because this story is happening now...but because it is so close.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":10}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":200987,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":8.4},"contentRating":"TV-MA","genre":["Drama","Sci-Fi","Thriller"],"datePublished":"2017-04-26","keywords":"rape,dystopia,violence against women,slavery,torture","actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0005253/","name":"Elisabeth Moss"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm2088803/","name":"Yvonne Strahovski"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001212/","name":"Joseph Fiennes"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0071026/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0108881/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0588005/","name":"Bruce Miller"}],"trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Season 4 Trailer","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi2726412313","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZTljMGNkYTMtMzE3MS00ZjM2LThjY2ItM2Q5YTVhYmI0ZmEzXkEyXkFqcGdeQXZ3ZXNsZXk@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZTljMGNkYTMtMzE3MS00ZjM2LThjY2ItM2Q5YTVhYmI0ZmEzXkEyXkFqcGdeQXZ3ZXNsZXk@._V1_.jpg","description":"Freedom is just the beginning. The Emmy-winning series, The Handmaid's Tale, returns for Season 4 on April 28, 2021, only on Hulu.\n\nThe cultural phenomenon picks up where we left off, with June's fight for freedom against Gilead. But the risks she takes bring unexpected and dangerous new challenges, and her desire for justice and revenge threaten to consume her and destroy her most cherished relationships."}}</script><metacontent="

The writing and acting is amazing. I can't wait for every Sunday evening. I wish I wouldn't have started it so I could binge watch the hole thing. There are parts that it takes a few seconds for your brain to process and then bang OMG laugh out loud funny. Rewind watch again funny. The story telling is masterful. The vacationers include the Mossbacher family - Nicole (Connie Britton), a successful type-A exec, who can't help but treat her family like disobedient employees; her husband, Mark (Steve Zahn), dealing with both an embarrassing health crisis and a terminal inferiority complex; their teenaged son, Quinn (Fred Hechinger), a socially awkward gamer, experiencing the wonder of nature for the very first time; their daughter, Olivia (Sydney Sweeney), and her friend, Paula (Brittany O'Grady), sharp-tongued college sophomores who cast a sardonic eye on the lifestyles and belief systems of everyone around them. The handsome, entitled Shane Patton (Jake Lacy) is here with his beautiful bride, Rachel (Alexandra Daddario). Shane and Rachel are in the throes of young love, but as they get to know each other better in this new, intimate environment, clouds of doubt appear - and by the time Shane's intrusive mother, Kitty (Molly Shannon) surprises them with an unwelcome visit, their fairytale honeymoon has begun to unravel. And finally, there is Tanya McQuoid (Jennifer Coolidge), a wealthy, unstable woman, recovering from the death of her mother, traveling alone to the hotel, looking for love and in desperate need of a massage."}}</script><metacontent="

Kocha, lubi, szanuje
Crazy, Stupid, Love.
programme.desc: Crazy, Stupid, Love.: Directed by Glenn Ficarra, John Requa. With Steve Carell, Ryan Gosling, Julianne Moore, Emma Stone. A middle-aged husband's life changes dramatically when his wife asks him for a divorce. He seeks to rediscover his manhood with the help of a newfound friend, Jacob, learning to pick up girls at bars." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt1570728/","name":"Crazy, Stupid, Love.","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTg2MjkwMTM0NF5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwMzc4NDg2NQ@@._V1_.jpg","description":"A middle-aged husband's life changes dramatically when his wife asks him for a divorce. He seeks to rediscover his manhood with the help of a newfound friend, Jacob, learning to pick up girls at bars.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt1570728/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"larann"},"dateCreated":"2011-08-06","inLanguage":"English","name":"Crazy,Stupid, Love Movie","reviewBody":"I wasn't sure if I wanted to see this movie at the theater,but I am really glad I did. The characters are well played out, not very likable at first, but after you get to know the cast, you really feel for everyone. I thought Julianne Moore & Steve Carrell had great chemistry with their relationship. Super script, nice directing, great casting with Robbie, the son. This movie will surprise you at how good it is. I loved how you saw the characters at work, at home, at the bar & with their friends. This was very well played out & comes together in the end extremely well. Ryan Gosling is very hot even when he is sleazy. Great date night movie!!"},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":491737,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7.4},"contentRating":"PG-13","genre":["Comedy","Drama","Romance"],"datePublished":"2011-07-29","keywords":"divorce,male objectification,marriage,unfaithfulness,adultery","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Crazy, Stupid, Love.","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi3722091801","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjA0MTY2NzgwMl5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwMzYzNDg4NA@@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjA0MTY2NzgwMl5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwMzYzNDg4NA@@._V1_.jpg","description":"Newly single Cal Weaver (Steve Carell) is taken on as wingman and protÃ©gÃ© to handsome, thirtysomething player Jacob Palmer (Ryan Gosling). programme.title: Finding Nemo
Gdzie jest Nemo
Finding Nemo
programme.desc:
Finding Nemo: Directed by Andrew Stanton, Lee Unkrich. With Albert Brooks, Ellen DeGeneres, Alexander Gould, Willem Dafoe. After his son is captured in the Great Barrier Reef and taken to Sydney, a timid clownfish sets out on a journey to bring him home." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0266543/","name":"Finding Nemo","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZTAzNWZlNmUtZDEzYi00ZjA5LWIwYjEtZGM1NWE1MjE4YWRhXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNjU0OTQ0OTY@._V1_.jpg","description":"After his son is captured in the Great Barrier Reef and taken to Sydney, a timid clownfish sets out on a journey to bring him home.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0266543/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"PizzicatoFishCrouch"},"dateCreated":"2006-03-20","inLanguage":"English","name":"Swimming with Sharks is a Whale of a Time","reviewBody":"Marlin, a nervous and neurotic clownfish is heavily overprotective of his son Nemo, who only wants to explore the sea in its entirety. When Nemo gets caught by a scuba diver and taken away, it is up to Marlin to swallow his own fears and find Nemo. The ensuing search and rescue organized by the him is a mass effort by swimming and flying creatures of all sizes and personalities, such as a threesome of vegetarian sharks, a fish with short term memory and an aged turtle, all helping him realise the error of his ways in restricting himself to just his home.

As charming as it is beautiful, Finding Nemo is a joy, both visually and cinematically. The characters are all so appealing and sweet that you want to hug each and every one of them, Nemo and Dory in particular. But the film transcends above just a generic animated film, for there are lessons to be learnt by it too. The film often tells a children's tale from an adult's point of view, with risky situations and emotional soul-searching putting stress on a disjointed family.

The sea is brought to us in such a memorable and unique way that there is brilliance and beauty in every frame. The animation is of all time high for Pixar, and the sound mixing and editing are also to be credited, as they capture the heart of the sea creditably. But perhaps the best thing about the film is the musical score by Thomas Newman. He creates the essence of the sea, as well as the emotions felt by the fish throughout. Note the masterwork that occurs as an upbeat, jovial number quickly escalates into something darker in a matter of minutes. In short, the music is superb.

The voice cast are capable and cannily chosen, from young Alexander Gould as the naïve Nemo, as well as Albert Brooks as the bumbling Marlin. But the star of the show is Ellen DeGeneres as Dory. As the forgetful but caring fish, she is sweet and soulful, and provides much of the comedy of the film. But the humour is also provided by the great script, which delivers a potentially dull story with wit and soul, and shies away from the sentimentality that could so easily arise of a Disney film. And the jokes, what jokes  from satire, spoof and slapstick, they'll be a one-liner for everybody here.

Gorgeous to look at and utterly adorable, Finding Nemo sets the standard for how animated movies should being terms of entertainment value as well as story and themes  ending with the touching, thought-provoking message of how too much protectiveness on the parent's side will repel, but, no matter how independent a child (or fish) believes themselves to be, they'll always need their parents.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":10}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":983049,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":8.1},"contentRating":"G","genre":["Animation","Adventure","Comedy"],"datePublished":"2003-09-03","keywords":"pufferfish,shark,great barrier reef,short term memory loss,protective father","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"3D Re-release Version","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi2687214105","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjMwMDYxNTUyMl5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwNTIwMjQ4Nw@@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjMwMDYxNTUyMl5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwNTIwMjQ4Nw@@._V1_.jpg","description":"After his son is captured in the Great Barrier Reef and taken to Sydney, a timid clownfish sets out on a journey to bring him home. "},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000983/","name":"Albert Brooks"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001122/","name":"Ellen DeGeneres"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1071252/","name":"Alexander Gould"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0004056/","name":"Andrew Stanton"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0881279/","name":"Lee Unkrich"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0017902/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0008970/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0004056/","name":"Andrew Stanton"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0677037/","name":"Bob Peterson"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0721675/","name":"David Reynolds"}],"duration":"PT1H40M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.desc: Queen Marie of Romania: Directed by Alexis Cahill, Brigitte Drodtloff. With Roxana Lupu, Daniel Plier, Richard Elfyn, Patrick Drury. Devastated by the First World War and plunged into political controversy, Romania's every hope accompanies its queen on her mission to Paris to lobby for international recognition of its great unification at the 1919 peace talks." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt9110902/","name":"Queen Marie of Romania","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYTExMWJhNzEtZWI1OS00YWM4LTk4YTYtODkyNzAzYTEyOTNmXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMjE4NzUxNDA@._V1_.jpg","description":"Devastated by the First World War and plunged into political controversy, Romania's every hope accompanies its queen on her mission to Paris to lobby for international recognition of its great unification at the 1919 peace talks.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt9110902/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"safsurfer"},"dateCreated":"2019-12-31","inLanguage":"English","name":"Slow boring and hard to get into.","reviewBody":"I can't comment on the historical accuracy so this review is just about the film as a period drama. I found it a bit slow for my tastes. The characters were dull and boring. Any actionable drama seemed forced and somewhat out of character for the characters. I'm guessing the writers and producers wanted it that way and maybe it is historically accurate but the pacing and dialog practically put me to sleep. Sorry this was only watchable, a 6 for me.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":6}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":1890,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7.4},"genre":["Drama"],"datePublished":"2019-11-08","keywords":"paris peace conference,romania,world war one,treaty of versailles","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Official Trailer","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi904511513","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMzA5ODQ2OTMtYmEyMi00N2NlLWI4NmMtYjUwODFiMzgyNmY5XkEyXkFqcGdeQXRyYW5zY29kZS13b3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMzA5ODQ2OTMtYmEyMi00N2NlLWI4NmMtYjUwODFiMzgyNmY5XkEyXkFqcGdeQXRyYW5zY29kZS13b3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg","description":""},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm5404849/","name":"Roxana Lupu"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm2088951/","name":"Daniel Plier"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0253355/","name":"Richard Elfyn"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0128636/","name":"Alexis Cahill"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0238186/","name":"Brigitte Drodtloff"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0087275/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0030727/","name":"Gabi Antal"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0128636/","name":"Alexis Cahill"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0238186/","name":"Brigitte Drodtloff"}],"duration":"PT1H50M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.desc:
The Lego Movie: Directed by Christopher Miller, Phil Lord. With Will Arnett, Elizabeth Banks, Craig Berry, Alison Brie. An ordinary LEGO construction worker, thought to be the prophesied as "special", is recruited to join a quest to stop an evil tyrant from gluing the LEGO universe into eternal stasis." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt1490017/","name":"The Lego Movie","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTg4MDk1ODExN15BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwNzIyNjg3MDE@._V1_.jpg","description":"An ordinary LEGO construction worker, thought to be the prophesied as "special", is recruited to join a quest to stop an evil tyrant from gluing the LEGO universe into eternal stasis.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt1490017/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"mutiaraherawati"},"dateCreated":"2014-03-04","inLanguage":"English","name":"Strong story in a very creative way","reviewBody":"If you watch the trailer and you think its just gonna be a fun stop-motion animated Lego movie, you were wrong. The Lego Movie is beyond fun. its creative and it brings back a lot childhood memories. The story was amazing, the jokes were hilarious, and they have great intention in details.

But, the most important thing, the movie remind us to be creative. Because sometimes, As we grow up, in someway, we stop being creative and just follow the rules and instruction. For adults, this movie will bring back your childhood memories and how you used to play randomly with those Lego. And for a kids, you'll just love this movie, and definitely makes you want to play with your own Lego.

totally worth watching movie! even your grandparents will enjoy this movie! 9/10","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":9}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":334423,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7.7},"contentRating":"PG","genre":["Animation","Adventure","Comedy"],"datePublished":"2014-02-12","keywords":"lego,good cop bad cop,based on toy,construction worker,computer animation","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Trailer #2","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi2178131993","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMzkyMjA1ODQzMV5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwMTQ2NzMyMzE@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMzkyMjA1ODQzMV5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwMTQ2NzMyMzE@._V1_.jpg","description":"An ordinary LEGO minifigure, mistakenly thought to be the extraordinary MasterBuilder, is recruited to join a quest to stop an evil LEGO tyrant from gluing the universe together. programme.desc: John Oliver, jedna z najbarwniejszych postaci amerykańskiej telewizji, zaprasza na ósmy sezon show, w którym prezentuje swój punkt widzenia i komentuje wydarzenia minionego tygodnia.
